alert.note: Alert for Dubuque; Jones (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 6:12AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jo Daviess, northwestern Jackson, southeastern Dubuque and northeastern Jones Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 611 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bernard, or 18 miles southwest of Dubuque, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bernard around 620 AM CDT. Zwingle around 630 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include La Motte, St. Donatus, Menominee and Galena. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
